name: 3/4 Sit-up
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: 45° Side Bend
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight down by your sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight down by your sides.
Step:2 Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, slowly bend your torso to one side, lowering your hand towards your knee.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat on the other side.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Advanced Tuck Back Lever
description: Advanced isometric that trains the lats and posterior chain to keep the body horizontal with straight arms. Scapulae stay retracted and depressed, elbows locked, and the core braced to resist hip drop. Key step toward the full lever and one‑leg variations.
howTo:
1) Setup: Dead‑hang with pronated grip. Lock elbows; retract and depress the shoulder blades before lifting.
2) Enter/Hold: Bring knees away from chest (advanced tuck). Keep back flat and hips level with shoulders.
2) Tension: Drive elbows toward hips to engage lats; brace abs to resist hip drop.
2) Cues: 'Straight arms', 'crush the bar', 'lock the ribs to the pelvis'.
2) Errors: Bent elbows, rounded upper back, losing scapular set.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Advanced Tuck Front Lever
description: Advanced isometric that trains the lats and posterior chain to keep the body horizontal with straight arms. Scapulae stay retracted and depressed, elbows locked, and the core braced to resist hip drop. Key step toward the full lever and one‑leg variations.
howTo:
1) Setup: Dead‑hang with pronated grip. Lock elbows; retract and depress the shoulder blades before lifting.
2) Enter/Hold: Bring knees away from chest (advanced tuck). Keep back flat and hips level with shoulders.
2) Tension: Drive elbows toward hips to engage lats; brace abs to resist hip drop.
2) Cues: 'Straight arms', 'crush the bar', 'lock the ribs to the pelvis'.
2) Errors: Bent elbows, rounded upper back, losing scapular set.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Advanced Tuck Planche
description: Advanced static hold that builds straight‑arm pressing strength and full‑body anti‑extension control. Requires strong anterior deltoids, triceps, and deep core while the shoulder blades stay protracted and slightly depressed. Increases shoulder torque versus tuck variations and develops control for harder planche progressions.
howTo:
1) Setup: Hands shoulder‑width; elbows locked. Protract and lightly depress the shoulder blades. Hollow body.
2) Enter/Hold: Lean forward until shoulders pass the wrists. Keep knees tucked/advanced‑tuck and back flat; push the floor away.
2) Breathing: Short exhales while maintaining bracing; avoid breath‑holding collapse.
2) Cues: 'Push tall', 'ribs down', 'squeeze glutes', 'externally rotate the shoulders'.
2) Errors: Elbow bend, scapular collapse, hips sag or piking.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Parallel Bar Support Hold
description: Support your bodyweight on parallel bars with straight arms and depressed shoulders.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Hollow Body Hold
description: Gymnastics basic hold: lie on your back, press the lower back to the floor, and elevate shoulders and legs.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Air Bike
description: Lie flat on your back with your hands placed behind your head.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your hands placed behind your head.
Step:2 Lift your legs off the ground and bend your knees at a 90-degree angle.
Step:3 Bring your right elbow towards your left knee while simultaneously straightening your right leg.
Step:4 Return to the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee while straightening your left leg.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides in a pedaling motion for the desired number of repetitions.

name: All Fours Squad Stretch
description: Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
Step:2 Extend one leg straight back, keeping your knee bent and your foot flexed.
Step:3 Slowly lower your hips towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your quads.
Step:4 Hold this position for 20-30 seconds.
Step:5 Switch legs and repeat the stretch on the other side.

name: All Fours Squad Stretch - Elevated Variation
description: Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
Step:2 Extend one leg straight back, keeping your knee bent and your foot flexed. Maintain elevated form throughout.
Step:3 Slowly lower your hips towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your quads.
Step:4 Hold this position for 20-30 seconds.
Step:5 Switch legs and repeat the stretch on the other side.

name: Alternate Heel Touchers
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight out to the sides, parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your shoulders off the ground and reach your right hand towards your right heel.
Step:4 Return to the starting position and repeat on the left side, reaching your left hand towards your left heel.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Alternating Bear Crawl
description: Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
Step:2 Lift your knees slightly off the ground, keeping your back flat and your core engaged.
Step:3 Move your right hand and left foot forward simultaneously, followed by your left hand and right foot.
Step:4 Continue crawling forward, alternating your hand and foot movements.
Step:5 Maintain a steady pace and keep your core tight throughout the exercise.
Step:6 (alternating variation) Continue for the desired distance or time.

name: Ankle Circles
description: Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you.
Step:2 Lift one leg off the ground and rotate your ankle in a circular motion.
Step:3 Perform the desired number of circles in one direction, then switch to the other direction.
Step:4 Repeat with the other leg.

name: Archer Pull Up
description: High‑tension pulling pattern where lats and upper back drive the motion with strict scapular control. Focus on keeping elbows tracking and the ribcage down to avoid compensations. Develops strength for unilateral and explosive progressions.
howTo:
1) Setup: Grip the bar/rings firmly; set scapulae down and back.
2) Descent/Ascent: Pull by bringing the chest toward the hands while keeping ribs down; lower under control.
2) Cues: 'Lead with the elbows', 'keep forearms vertical', 'stay tight in the midline'.
2) Errors: Flaring elbows, kipping unintentionally, craning the neck.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Archer Push Up
description: High‑tension horizontal/vertical pressing emphasizing scapular stability and full‑body bracing. Chest, anterior deltoids and triceps drive the movement while the core prevents sag or flaring. Bridges the gap to ring variations and straight‑arm strength.
howTo:
1) Setup: Hands slightly wider than shoulders; screw palms into the floor; elbows fully extended.
2) Descent/Ascent: Keep ribs down and glutes tight; press through full range without elbow flare.
2) Cues: 'Spread the floor', 'stack shoulders over wrists', 'move as one piece'.
2) Errors: Hip sag, shrugging shoulders, partial reps.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Arm Slingers Hanging Bent Knee Legs
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest, bringing them as close to your elbows as possible.
Step:3 Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Arm Slingers Hanging Straight Legs
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight down.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight down.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up in front of you until they are parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Hold for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Arms Apart Circular Toe Touch (male)
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms extended to the sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms extended to the sides.
Step:2 Keeping your legs straight, bend forward at the waist and reach down towards your toes with your right hand.
Step:3 As you reach down, simultaneously lift your left leg straight up behind you, maintaining balance.
Step:4 Return to the starting position and repeat the movement with your left hand reaching towards your toes and your right leg lifting up behind you.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Arms Overhead Full Sit-up (male)
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Extend your arms overhead, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is upright.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Astride Jumps (male)
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position.
Step:3 Jump explosively upwards, extending your legs and arms.
Step:4 While in the air, spread your legs apart and bring your arms out to the sides.
Step:5 Land softly with your feet shoulder-width apart, bending your knees to absorb the impact.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Back And Forth Step
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Step forward with your right foot, bending your knee and lowering your body into a lunge position.
Step:3 Push off with your right foot and step back to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat the movement with your left foot, alternating legs with each step.
Step:5 Continue stepping back and forth, maintaining a steady pace.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired duration or number of repetitions.

name: Back Lever
description: Advanced isometric that trains the lats and posterior chain to keep the body horizontal with straight arms. Scapulae stay retracted and depressed, elbows locked, and the core braced to resist hip drop. Key step toward the full lever and one‑leg variations.
howTo:
1) Setup: Dead‑hang with pronated grip. Lock elbows; retract and depress the shoulder blades before lifting.
2) Enter/Hold: Bring knees away from chest (advanced tuck). Keep back flat and hips level with shoulders.
2) Tension: Drive elbows toward hips to engage lats; brace abs to resist hip drop.
2) Cues: 'Straight arms', 'crush the bar', 'lock the ribs to the pelvis'.
2) Errors: Bent elbows, rounded upper back, losing scapular set.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Back Lever (Una Pierna)
description: Advanced isometric that trains the lats and posterior chain to keep the body horizontal with straight arms. Scapulae stay retracted and depressed, elbows locked, and the core braced to resist hip drop. Key step toward the full lever and one‑leg variations.
howTo:
1) Setup: Dead‑hang with pronated grip. Lock elbows; retract and depress the shoulder blades before lifting.
2) Enter/Hold: Bring knees away from chest (advanced tuck). Keep back flat and hips level with shoulders.
2) Tension: Drive elbows toward hips to engage lats; brace abs to resist hip drop.
2) Cues: 'Straight arms', 'crush the bar', 'lock the ribs to the pelvis'.
2) Errors: Bent elbows, rounded upper back, losing scapular set.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Back Pec Stretch
description: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight out in front of you, parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Cross your arms in front of your body, with your right arm over your left arm.
Step:4 Interlock your fingers and rotate your palms away from your body.
Step:5 Slowly raise your arms up and away from your body, feeling a stretch in your back and chest.
Step:6 Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then release.
Step:7 Repeat on the opposite side.

name: Backward Jump
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and jump backwards, pushing off with both feet.
Step:3 Land softly on the balls of your feet, bending your knees to absorb the impact.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Single-Leg Step-Down
description: Stand on a bench, slowly lower one leg to the floor and return up. Control the eccentric phase.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Balance Board
description: Place the balance board on a flat surface.
howTo:
Step:1 Place the balance board on a flat surface.
Step:2 Step onto the balance board with one foot, ensuring it is centered.
Step:3 Slowly shift your weight onto the foot on the balance board, keeping your core engaged.
Step:4 Maintain your balance and stability as you hold the position for a desired amount of time.
Step:5 Repeat the exercise with the other foot.

name: Basic Toe Touch (male)
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides.
Step:2 Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent.
Step:3 Reach down towards your toes with your hands, keeping your legs as straight as possible.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bear Crawl
description: Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
Step:2 Lift your knees slightly off the ground, keeping your back flat and your core engaged.
Step:3 Move your right hand and left foot forward simultaneously, followed by your left hand and right foot.
Step:4 Continue crawling forward, alternating your hand and foot movements.
Step:5 Maintain a steady pace and keep your core tight throughout the exercise.
Step:6 Continue for the desired distance or time.

name: Bench Dip (knees Bent)
description: Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping the edge next to your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping the edge next to your hips.
Step:2 Slide your butt off the bench and straighten your legs in front of you, keeping your heels on the ground.
Step:3 Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back close to the bench.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bench Dip On Floor
description: Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping the edge, fingers pointing forward.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping the edge, fingers pointing forward.
Step:2 Slide your butt off the bench, supporting your weight with your hands.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
Step:4 Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bench Hip Extension
description: Sit on a bench with your back against the bench and your feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back against the bench and your feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands on the bench for support.
Step:3 Engage your glutes and hamstrings, then lift your hips off the bench until your body forms a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bench Pull-ups
description: Position yourself under a bar or a sturdy horizontal surface that is at chest height.
howTo:
Step:1 Position yourself under a bar or a sturdy horizontal surface that is at chest height.
Step:2 Grab the bar or surface with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Hang with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step:4 Pull your chest towards the bar or surface by squeezing your shoulder blades together and bending your elbows.
Step:5 Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar or surface.
Step:6 Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bent Knee Lying Twist (male)
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Extend your arms out to the sides, perpendicular to your body.
Step:3 Keeping your knees together, slowly lower them to one side, aiming to touch the ground with your knees.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then engage your core and slowly lift your knees back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the movement to the other side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Biceps Leg Concentration Curl
description: Sit on a bench with your legs spread apart and your feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on a bench with your legs spread apart and your feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold a dumbbell in one hand and place your elbow on the inside of your thigh, just above the knee.
Step:3 With your palm facing up, curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder while keeping your upper arm stationary.
Step:4 Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

name: Biceps Narrow Pull-ups
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Engage your core and pull yourself up towards the bar, focusing on using your biceps to lift your body.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Biceps Pull-up
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Engage your core and pull yourself up by bending your elbows, bringing your chest towards the bar.
Step:3 Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Body-up
description: Start by placing your hands on a raised surface, such as a bench or parallel bars, with your palms facing down and fingers pointing forward.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by placing your hands on a raised surface, such as a bench or parallel bars, with your palms facing down and fingers pointing forward.
Step:2 Extend your legs out in front of you, keeping your heels on the ground and your body straight.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides, until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then push through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your body back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Drop Jump Squat
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Step:3 Jump up explosively, extending your hips, knees, and ankles.
Step:4 While in mid-air, quickly bring your feet together.
Step:5 Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately drop back into a squat position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Incline Side Plank
description: Start by lying on your side with your legs extended and stacked on top of each other.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by lying on your side with your legs extended and stacked on top of each other.
Step:2 Place your forearm on the ground directly below your shoulder, with your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step:3 Engage your core and lift your hips off the ground, creating a straight line from your head to your feet.
Step:4 Hold this position for the desired amount of time.
Step:5 Lower your hips back down to the ground and repeat on the other side.

name: Bodyweight Kneeling Triceps Extension
description: Kneel down on the ground with your knees hip-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Kneel down on the ground with your knees hip-width apart.
Step:2 Place your hands on the ground in front of you, shoulder-width apart, fingers pointing forward.
Step:3 Extend your legs straight behind you, balancing on your toes and hands, forming a straight line from head to heels.
Step:4 Bend your elbows and lower your upper body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Side Lying Biceps Curl
description: Lie on your side with your legs extended and your head supported by your arm.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie on your side with your legs extended and your head supported by your arm.
Step:2 Hold your upper arm against your side and bend your elbow to curl your forearm towards your shoulder.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your forearm back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Squatting Row
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding onto a sturdy object or suspension trainer with your arms extended.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding onto a sturdy object or suspension trainer with your arms extended.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
Step:3 From the squat position, pull your body up towards the object or suspension trainer, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Squatting Row (with Towel)
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a towel in front of you with your palms facing down.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a towel in front of you with your palms facing down.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
Step:3 As you lower into the squat, simultaneously pull the towel towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then slowly return to the starting position while extending your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Standing Calf Raise
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward.
Step:2 Place your hands on a wall or stable surface for balance.
Step:3 Slowly raise your heels off the ground, lifting your body weight onto the balls of your feet.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Standing Close-grip One Arm Row
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold a dumbbell in one hand with a neutral grip.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold a dumbbell in one hand with a neutral grip.
Step:2 Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step:3 Pull the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: Bodyweight Standing Close-grip Row
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step:3 Extend your arms straight in front of you, gripping the bar or handles with a close grip.
Step:4 Pull the bar or handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release and return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Standing One Arm Row
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
Step:2 Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step:3 Let the dumbbell hang straight down in front of you, with your arm fully extended.
Step:4 Pull the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
Step:5 Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
Step:6 Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: Bodyweight Standing One Arm Row (with Towel)
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold a towel with one hand.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold a towel with one hand.
Step:2 Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step:3 Pull the towel towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the towel back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.

name: Bodyweight Standing Row
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Grasp a bar or handles with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
Step:3 Keep your back straight and core engaged.
Step:4 Pull the bar or handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement.
Step:6 Slowly release and extend your arms back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Standing Row (with Towel)
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a towel in front of you with both hands.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a towel in front of you with both hands.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step:3 Pull the towel towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly release the tension and return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bottoms-up
description: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
Step:2 Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest, keeping your feet off the ground.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your hips off the ground, bringing your knees towards your head.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Box Jump Down With One Leg Stabilization
description: Stand in front of a box or platform with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand in front of a box or platform with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Bend your knees and jump onto the box, landing softly with one foot on the box and the other foot hanging off the edge.
Step:3 Stabilize yourself on the box with the foot that is on it, while keeping the other foot off the ground.
Step:4 Hold this position for a few seconds, engaging your calf muscles to maintain balance.
Step:5 Slowly step down with the foot that is on the box, returning to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat the exercise with the other leg.

name: Bridge - Mountain Climber (cross Body)
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your right foot off the ground, bringing your right knee towards your left elbow.
Step:3 Return your right foot to the starting position and repeat the movement with your left foot towards your right elbow.
Step:4 Continue alternating sides, moving at a controlled pace.
Step:5 Keep your hips level and avoid lifting your hips too high or sagging them too low.
Step:6 Maintain a steady breathing pattern throughout the exercise.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Burpee
description: Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and placing your hands on the floor in front of you.
Step:3 Kick your feet back into a push-up position.
Step:4 Perform a push-up, keeping your body in a straight line.
Step:5 Jump your feet back into the squat position.
Step:6 Jump up explosively, reaching your arms overhead.
Step:7 Land softly and immediately lower back into a squat position to begin the next repetition.

name: Burpees
description: Burpees: a bodyweight exercise in the cardio category.
howTo: Párate derecho. Baja en cuclillas y coloca las manos en el suelo. Salta con los pies hacia atrás a posición de plancha. Realiza una flexión. Salta con los pies hacia las manos. Salta verticalmente con los brazos arriba. Aterriza y repite. Ejercicio de cuerpo completo que eleva rápidamente la frecuencia cardíaca.

name: Butt-ups
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands by your sides, palms facing down.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your legs off the ground, bringing your knees towards your chest.
Step:4 At the top of the movement, squeeze your abs and pause for a moment.
Step:5 Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Butterfly Yoga Pose
description: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
Step:2 Bend your knees and bring the soles of your feet together, allowing your knees to fall out to the sides.
Step:3 Hold onto your ankles or feet with your hands.
Step:4 Sit up tall and lengthen your spine.
Step:5 Gently press your knees down towards the floor, feeling a stretch in your inner thighs.
Step:6 Hold this position for a few breaths.
Step:7 To release, slowly bring your knees back up and extend your legs.

name: Calf Push Stretch With Hands Against Wall
description: Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
Step:2 Place your hands against the wall at shoulder height.
Step:3 Step back with one foot, keeping your heel on the ground and your leg straight.
Step:4 Bend your front knee slightly and lean forward, feeling a stretch in your calf.
Step:5 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds.
Step:6 Switch legs and repeat the stretch.

name: Calf Push Stretch With Hands Against Wall Elite
description: Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
Step:2 Place your hands against the wall at shoulder height.
Step:3 Step back with one foot, keeping your heel on the ground and your leg straight.
Step:4 Bend your front knee slightly and lean forward, feeling a stretch in your calf.
Step:5 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds.
Step:6 Switch legs and repeat the stretch. Focus on elite movement.

name: Calf Stretch With Hands Against Wall
description: Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
Step:2 Place your hands against the wall at shoulder height.
Step:3 Step your right foot back, keeping your heel on the ground and your leg straight.
Step:4 Bend your left knee and lean forward, keeping your back leg straight and your heel on the ground.
Step:5 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds.
Step:6 Switch legs and repeat the stretch.

name: Captains Chair Straight Leg Raise
description: Sit on the captain's chair with your back against the backrest and your forearms resting on the arm pads.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the captain's chair with your back against the backrest and your forearms resting on the arm pads.
Step:2 Keep your upper body stable and your back straight.
Step:3 Engage your abs and lift your legs up in front of you, keeping them straight.
Step:4 Continue lifting until your legs are parallel to the ground or as high as you can comfortably go.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chair Leg Extended Stretch
description: Sit on the edge of a chair with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the edge of a chair with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Extend one leg straight out in front of you, keeping your heel on the ground.
Step:3 Lean forward slightly, feeling a stretch in your quadriceps.
Step:4 Hold this position for 20-30 seconds.
Step:5 Switch legs and repeat the stretch.

name: Chair Leg Extended Stretch With Modified
description: Sit on the edge of a chair with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the edge of a chair with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Extend one leg straight out in front of you, keeping your heel on the ground.
Step:3 Lean forward slightly, feeling a stretch in your quadriceps.
Step:4 Hold this position for 20-30 seconds. Focus on modified movement.
Step:5 Switch legs and repeat the stretch.

name: Chest And Front Of Shoulder Stretch
description: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height.
Step:3 Cross your arms in front of your body, with your right arm on top of your left arm.
Step:4 Interlace your fingers and press your palms together.
Step:5 Gently squeeze your shoulder blades together and push your hands forward, feeling a stretch in your chest and front of your shoulders.
Step:6 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then release.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chest And Front Of Shoulder Stretch Micro
description: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height.
Step:3 Cross your arms in front of your body, with your right arm on top of your left arm.
Step:4 Interlace your fingers and press your palms together.
Step:5 Gently squeeze your shoulder blades together and push your hands forward, feeling a stretch in your chest and front of your shoulders.
Step:6 (micro variation) Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then release.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chest Dip
description: Position yourself on parallel bars with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
howTo:
Step:1 Position yourself on parallel bars with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step:2 Lower your body by bending your elbows until your shoulders are below your elbows.
Step:3 Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chest Dip (on Dip-pull-up Cage)
description: Adjust the dip bars to a height that allows you to comfortably grip them.
howTo:
Step:1 Adjust the dip bars to a height that allows you to comfortably grip them.
Step:2 Stand between the bars and place your hands on each bar, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Jump up and straighten your arms, supporting your body weight on the bars.
Step:4 Bend your knees and cross your ankles behind you.
Step:5 Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your chest up and your shoulders down.
Step:6 Continue lowering until your shoulders are below your elbows or until you feel a stretch in your chest.
Step:7 Push through your palms and extend your elbows to raise your body back up to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chest Dip On Straight Bar
description: Grab the parallel bars with your palms facing down and your arms fully extended.
howTo:
Step:1 Grab the parallel bars with your palms facing down and your arms fully extended.
Step:2 Bend your knees and cross your ankles.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your arms until your shoulders are below your elbows.
Step:4 Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chest Tap Push-up (male)
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your body in a straight line.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your body in a straight line.
Step:2 Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
Step:3 As you lower yourself, tap your chest with your right hand.
Step:4 Push yourself back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the movement, this time tapping your chest with your left hand.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chin-up
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Engage your core and pull your body up towards the bar, leading with your chest.
Step:3 Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chin-up Diagonal
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Engage your core and pull your body up towards the bar, leading with your chest.
Step:3 Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step:4 (diagonal variation) Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chin-ups (Agarre Supino)
description: Pull-up with palms facing towards you (supinated). Places more emphasis on the biceps.
howTo: Agarra la barra con las palmas hacia ti a la anchura de los shoulders. Cuelga con brazos extendeds. Tira hacia arriba llevando el pecho hacia la barra hasta que la barbilla supere la barra. Baja con control hasta extender completamente los brazos. El agarre supino facilita el movimiento y enfatiza los bíceps.

name: Chin-ups (narrow Parallel Grip)
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with a narrow parallel grip, palms facing towards you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with a narrow parallel grip, palms facing towards you.
Step:2 Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:3 Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Circles Knee Stretch
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and lift your heels off the ground, balancing on the balls of your feet.
Step:3 Keeping your knees bent, rotate your knees in a circular motion, first clockwise and then counterclockwise.
Step:4 Perform the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Clap Push Up
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your core engaged.
Step:3 Push through your palms explosively to propel your body off the ground.
Step:4 While in mid-air, clap your hands together before landing back in the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Clock Push-up
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
Step:2 Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
Step:3 As you lower, rotate your body to the left, extending your left arm straight out to the side.
Step:4 Push back up to the starting position, while rotating your body to the center.
Step:5 Repeat the push-up, this time rotating your body to the right and extending your right arm out to the side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides with each repetition.

name: Clock Push-up Extreme
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
Step:2 Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
Step:3 As you lower, rotate your body to the left, extending your left arm straight out to the side. Focus on extreme movement.
Step:4 Push back up to the starting position, while rotating your body to the center.
Step:5 Repeat the push-up, this time rotating your body to the right and extending your right arm out to the side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides with each repetition.

name: Close Grip Chin-up
description: Grab the pull-up bar with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Grab the pull-up bar with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
Step:3 Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:4 Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Close-grip Push-up
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands placed close together, directly under your shoulders.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands placed close together, directly under your shoulders.
Step:2 Engage your core and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Step:3 Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Close-grip Push-up (on Knees)
description: Start by getting on your hands and knees, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your knees hip-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by getting on your hands and knees, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your knees hip-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your upper body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
Step:3 Pause for a moment when your chest is just above the ground.
Step:4 Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Cocoons
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Cocoons With Mega
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Emphasize mega control.

name: Colgado Activo (Active Hang)
description: Hang from the bar with active shoulders (depressed, away from the ears) and a hollow body. Foundational scapular control for pulling and preparation for advanced movements like the muscle up.
howTo: Cuelga de una barra con los brazos extendeds. A diferencia del dead hang, activa los shoulders tirando de los omóplatos hacia abajo y juntándolos. Tu cuerpo debe subir unos centímetros. Keep esta activación. Este ejercicio fortalece la musculatura escapular y es fundamental para dominadas correctas.

name: Colgado Pasivo (Dead Hang)
description: Colgado Pasivo (Dead Hang): a bodyweight exercise in the skill_static category.
howTo: Cuelga de una barra con los brazos completamente extendeds y los shoulders relajados. Keep las legs juntas o ligeramente flexionadas. Respira normalmente. Este ejercicio desarrolla fuerza de agarre y resistencia en shoulders. Es la base para todos los ejercicios de tracción.

name: Crab Twist Toe Touch
description: Start by sitting on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by sitting on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Step:2 Place your hands behind you, fingers pointing towards your feet, and lift your hips off the ground.
Step:3 Extend one leg straight out in front of you while simultaneously reaching your opposite hand towards your toes.
Step:4 Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Cross Body Crunch
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your upper body off the ground and twist to bring your right elbow towards your left knee.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat on the other side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Crunch (hands Overhead)
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight above your head.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward towards your knees.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Crunch Floor
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engage your abs and lift your shoulders off the ground, curling forward towards your knees.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Nordic Curl (Assisted)
description: Posterior chain exercise for hamstrings. Use resistance bands or your hands to assist on the way up.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Nordic Curl (Negatives)
description: Focus only on the eccentric phase, lowering the torso towards the floor as slowly as possible.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Nordic Curl (Full)
description: Full eccentric and concentric Nordic curl without assistance. Elite-level hamstring strength.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Curl-up
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Curtsey Squat
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Take a step diagonally behind and across your body with your right foot, crossing it behind your left leg.
Step:3 Bend both knees as if you were curtsying, lowering your body towards the ground.
Step:4 Keep your torso upright and your weight on your front foot.
Step:5 Push through your front foot to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat on the other side, stepping diagonally behind and across your body with your left foot.

name: Dead Bug
description: Lie flat on your back with your arms extended towards the ceiling.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your arms extended towards the ceiling.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lift your legs off the ground, creating a 90-degree angle at your hips and knees.
Step:3 Engage your core and lower back to press your lower back into the ground.
Step:4 Slowly lower your right arm and left leg towards the ground, keeping them straight and hovering just above the floor.
Step:5 Pause for a moment, then return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat the movement with your left arm and right leg.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Decline Crunch
description: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head or across your chest.
Step:3 Engage your abs and lift your upper body towards your knees, curling your torso.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Decline Push-up
description: Place your hands on the ground slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your feet elevated on a stable surface.
howTo:
Step:1 Place your hands on the ground slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your feet elevated on a stable surface.
Step:2 Keep your body in a straight line from head to toe, engaging your core muscles.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
Step:4 Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Decline Sit-up
description: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your knees bent.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your knees bent.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head or across your chest.
Step:3 Engage your abs and lift your upper body off the bench, curling forward towards your knees.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dedos a la Barra (Toes to Bar)
description: Dedos a la Barra (Toes to Bar): a bodyweight exercise in the core category.
howTo: Cuélgate de una barra. Levanta las legs rectas hacia arriba hasta tocar la barra con los dedos de los pies. En movimientos estrictos, evita el balanceo. En versión kipping, usa un ligero swing para momentum. Baja con control. Requiere gran fuerza de core y flexibilidad.

name: Diamond Push-up
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands close together, forming a diamond shape with your thumbs and index fingers.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands close together, forming a diamond shape with your thumbs and index fingers.
Step:2 Keep your body in a straight line from head to toe, engaging your core and glutes.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the diamond shape formed by your hands, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dominada a Un Brazo (Asistida con Dedos)
description: Perform the pull-up with one arm while the other assists minimally, grabbing the wrist or using one or two fingers.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Dominada a Un Brazo (Negativas)
description: Controlled eccentric (lowering) with one arm. Caution: High stress on the elbow.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Dominada Arquero (Asistida)
description: Dominada de arquero usando bandas de resistencia o anillas para facilitar el movimiento unilateral.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Dominada Explosiva (Pecho a la Barra)
description: Execute a pull-up with maximal speed and explosive intent. Aim to pull high enough that the chest or sternum contacts the bar (C2B). Foundational for the pulling phase of the muscle up.
howTo: Desde el colgado, tira explosivamente hacia arriba llevando el pecho a la barra, no solo la barbilla. En el pico, el pecho debe tocar o estar muy cerca de la barra. Baja con control. Este ejercicio desarrolla potencia explosiva de tracción y prepara para muscle ups.

name: Dominadas (Agarre Ancho)
description: Dominadas (Agarre Ancho): a bodyweight exercise in the strength category.
howTo: Agarra la barra con las palmas hacia adelante, separadas más que el ancho de shoulders (aproximadamente 1.5 veces). Tira hacia arriba hasta que la barbilla supere la barra. El agarre ancho enfatiza el trabajo de la espalda superior y los dorsales, haciendo el ejercicio más difícil.

name: One-Arm Pull-Ups
description: The pinnacle of pulling strength: a full pull-up using only one arm.
howTo: Agarra la barra con una sola mano, la other mano libre a un lado o detrás de la espalda. Keep el cuerpo lo más recto posible minimizando rotación. Tira hacia arriba hasta que la barbilla supere la barra usando solo un brazo. Baja con control. Uno de los ejercicios más difíciles de calistenia.

name: Dominadas a Una Mano (Asistidas)
description: Dominadas a Una Mano (Asistidas): a bodyweight exercise in the strength category.
howTo: Agarra la barra con una mano. Con la other mano, agarra la muñeca o el antebrazo del brazo que está en la barra. Tira hacia arriba usando principalmente el brazo en la barra, mientras el otro asiste. Progresivamente reduce la asistencia agarrando más abajo.

name: Dominadas Anchas
description: Pronated pull-up with a grip significantly wider than shoulder-width.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Archer Pull-Ups
description: Dominada unilateral donde un brazo tira mientras el otro se mantiene recto como asistencia.
howTo: Agarra la barra con las manos muy separadas. Tira hacia arriba llevando el cuerpo hacia un lado, manteniendo ese brazo flexionado mientras el otro se extiende. Alterna los lados. Esta variación desarrolla fuerza unilateral necesaria para dominadas a una mano.

name: Dominadas Asistidas (Banda)
description: Dominadas Asistidas (Banda): a bodyweight exercise in the strength category.
howTo: Coloca una banda de resistencia en la barra. Agarra la barra y coloca las knees o pies en la banda. La banda te asistirá reduciendo tu peso corporal. Tira hacia arriba hasta que la barbilla supere la barra. Baja con control. Usa bandas progresivamente más ligeras.

name: Dominadas Comando
description: Dominada con agarre mixto/neutral, tirando de la cabeza hacia un lado de la barra. Introduce trabajo unilateral.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Pull-Ups
description: Pull-Ups: a bodyweight exercise in the strength category.
howTo: Agarra la barra con las palmas hacia adelante a la anchura de los shoulders. Cuelga con brazos completamente extendeds. Tira hacia arriba llevando el pecho hacia la barra hasta que la barbilla supere la barra. Keep el core activado y evita el balanceo. Baja con control hasta extender completamente los brazos.

name: L-Sit Pull-Ups
description: High‑tension pulling pattern where lats and upper back drive the motion with strict scapular control. Focus on keeping elbows tracking and the ribcage down to avoid compensations. Develops strength for unilateral and explosive progressions.
howTo:
1) Setup: Grip the bar/rings firmly; set scapulae down and back.
2) Descent/Ascent: Pull by bringing the chest toward the hands while keeping ribs down; lower under control.
2) Cues: 'Lead with the elbows', 'keep forearms vertical', 'stay tight in the midline'.
2) Errors: Flaring elbows, kipping unintentionally, craning the neck.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Typewriter Pull-Ups
description: Pull up and hold at the top, then shift from one hand to the other, straightening the opposite arm.
howTo: Pull to the top of a standard pull-up. At the top, move horizontally to one side while keeping the chin over the bar, then traverse to the other side. Lower under control. Requires strong grip and back control.

name: Negative Pull-Ups
description: Jump to the top position and lower as slowly and controlled as possible (3–5 seconds).
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Negative Pull-Ups
description: Negative Pull-Ups: a bodyweight exercise in the strength category.
howTo: Salta o usa un apoyo para llegar a la posición superior de una dominada con la barbilla sobre la barra. Desde ahí, baja lo más lento posible (3-5 segundos mínimo) con control total hasta extender completamente los brazos. Repite. Las negativas son la mejor forma de desarrollar fuerza para dominadas completas.

name: Donkey Calf Raise
description: Stand with your toes on an elevated surface, such as a step or block.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your toes on an elevated surface, such as a step or block.
Step:2 Place your hands on a stable support, such as a wall or railing, for balance.
Step:3 Raise your heels as high as possible, lifting your body weight onto the balls of your feet.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dragon Flag
description: Anti-extension hold with the body completely straight, supported only by the upper back.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Dragon Flag
description: Dragon Flag: a bodyweight exercise in the core category.
howTo: Lie on a bench and grip the edge behind your head. Lift the entire body until only the shoulders touch the bench, keeping the body completely straight and rigid. Lower under control while maintaining a straight body, then raise back to the top. Iconic core exercise popularized by Bruce Lee; requires extreme core strength.

name: Dragon Flag (Tuck)
description: Full-body anti-extension hold performed with the knees tucked to reduce leverage.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Dragon Flag (Negatives)
description: From the vertical position, lower the straight body as slowly and controlled as possible.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Dragon Flag (Negatives)
description: Dragon Flag (Negatives): a bodyweight exercise in the core category.
howTo: Lie on a bench and grip the edge behind your head. Lift the body until only the shoulders touch the bench, keeping a straight body. From this position, lower the straight body as slowly as possible (5–8 seconds) while maintaining full rigidity. One of the most challenging core exercises.

name: Dragon Flag (One Leg)
description: Dragon Flag progression with one leg extended and the other tucked, increasing difficulty.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Drop Push Up
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your chest towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:3 Once your chest is just above the ground, quickly drop your knees to the ground.
Step:4 Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dynamic Chest Stretch (male)
description: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight out to the sides, parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Slowly bring your arms forward, crossing them in front of your body.
Step:4 Feel the stretch in your chest muscles.
Step:5 Hold the stretch for 10-30 seconds.
Step:6 Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Elbow Dips
description: Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping the edge next to your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping the edge next to your hips.
Step:2 Slide your hips forward off the bench and straighten your legs, keeping your heels on the ground.
Step:3 Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back close to the bench.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your hands to straighten your arms and lift your body back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Elbow Lift - Reverse Push-up
description: Start by lying face down on the ground with your legs extended and your hands placed directly under your shoulders.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by lying face down on the ground with your legs extended and your hands placed directly under your shoulders.
Step:2 Engage your core and press through your palms to lift your upper body off the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Step:3 Pause at the top for a moment, squeezing your upper back muscles.
Step:4 Slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Elbow-to-knee
description: Start by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engage your abs and lift your upper body off the ground, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee.
Step:4 At the same time, bring your left knee towards your right elbow, creating a twisting motion.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body and extend your legs back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat the movement, this time bringing your left elbow towards your right knee and your right knee towards your left elbow.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Elevación de Pantorrillas (Dos Piernas)
description: Elevación de Pantorrillas (Dos Piernas): a bodyweight exercise in the strength category.
howTo: Párate con los pies a la anchura de hips, preferiblemente con las puntas de los pies en un escalón para mayor rango. Levanta los talones lo más alto posible poniéndote en puntas de pies. Keep arriba 1 segundo. Baja con control hasta que los talones estén por debajo del nivel de los dedos (si estás en escalón).

name: Calf Raise (Single Leg)
description: Calf Raise (Single Leg): a bodyweight exercise in the strength category.
howTo: Stand on one leg with the other leg lightly flexed behind. Use a wall or support only for balance if needed. Raise the heel as high as possible, pause for 1 second, then lower under control. The single-leg version significantly increases intensity.

name: Leg Raise (Straight Legs)
description: Leg Raise (Straight Legs): a bodyweight exercise in the core category.
howTo: Lie on your back with hands under the glutes. Keep the legs completely straight. Raise the legs until they are perpendicular to the floor (90 degrees). Lower under control until the heels hover a few centimeters above the floor. Do not let the lower back arch.

name: Leg Raise (Bent Knees)
description: Leg Raise (Bent Knees): a bodyweight exercise in the core category.
howTo: Lie on your back with hands under the glutes or by your sides. Bend the knees to 90 degrees. Lift the knees towards the chest while maintaining the 90-degree bend. Lower under control until the heels nearly touch the floor. Keep the lower back on the ground.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
description: Hanging Leg Raise: a bodyweight exercise in the core category.
howTo: Hang from a bar with arms extended. Keep the legs straight. Raise the legs forward until they are parallel to the floor or higher. Lower under control without swinging. Avoid using momentum. This variation is harder because you must stabilize the whole body.

name: Hanging Leg Raises
description: Hanging from a bar, raise the legs straight to hip height (L-sit) or all the way to the bar.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Hanging Knee Raises
description: Hanging from a bar, lift the knees to the chest under control. Targets lower abs and compression.
howTo:
Step:1 Get into the starting position described by the exercise name.
Step:2 Perform the movement under control through a comfortable range of motion.
Step:3 Breathe steadily and maintain good posture.
Step:4 Return to the start and repeat for the target reps or time.

name: Elevator
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Place your hands on your hips or cross them in front of your chest.
Step:3 Keeping your back straight, slowly bend forward at the waist, lowering your upper body towards the ground.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly raise your upper body back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Endurance Style One Arm Dip
description: Stand facing away from a bench or chair, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand facing away from a bench or chair, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Place one hand on the bench or chair behind you, fingers pointing towards your body. Maintain endurance form throughout.
Step:3 Extend your legs out in front of you, keeping your heels on the ground.
Step:4 Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back close to the bench or chair.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat with the other arm.

name: Equilibrio de Rana (Frog Stand)
description: Nivel E: Equilibrio básico en brazos con knees apoyadas sobre los codos. Desarrolla el equilibrio a baja altura y la fuerza de compresión del core.
howTo: Colócate en cuclillas con las manos en el suelo delante. Inclínate hacia adelante colocando las knees sobre los codos. Continúa inclinándote hasta que los pies despeguen del suelo. Keep la mirada adelante y el peso sobre las manos. Este es el primer paso hacia el equilibrio de manos.

name: Escaladores (Mountain Climbers)
description: Escaladores (Mountain Climbers): a bodyweight exercise in the cardio category.
howTo: Comienza en posición de plancha alta con brazos extendeds. Keep las hips bajas. Lleva una knee hacia el pecho rápidamente. Alterna las legs en un movimiento de carrera. Keep el core activado y las hips estables. Aumenta la velocidad para mayor intensidad cardiovascular.

name: Extended Style Inverted Row
description: Set up a bar at waist height or use a suspension trainer.
howTo:
Step:1 Set up a bar at waist height or use a suspension trainer.
Step:2 Stand facing the bar or suspension trainer, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Grab the bar or handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Lean back, keeping your body straight and your heels on the ground.
Step:5 Pull your chest towards the bar or handles, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Perform with extended intensity.

name: Fierce Style Forward Lunge (male)
description: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
Step:2 Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge position.
Step:3 Bend your right knee to about 90 degrees, keeping your knee aligned with your ankle.
Step:4 Push off with your right foot and return to the starting position.
Step:5 (fierce variation) Repeat with your left leg, alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Firm Style Hanging Oblique Knee Raise
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest, twisting your torso to the side as you do so.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat on the other side, twisting your torso in the opposite direction.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions. Emphasize firm control.

name: Flag
description: Start by gripping a vertical pole with both hands, palms facing each other, and arms fully extended.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by gripping a vertical pole with both hands, palms facing each other, and arms fully extended.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Using your core and upper body strength, raise your legs until they are parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Hold this position for as long as you can, maintaining a straight body line.
Step:5 Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Flexion Leg Sit Up (bent Knee)
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 At the same time, lift your legs off the ground, bending your knees and bringing them towards your chest.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body and legs back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Flexion Leg Sit Up (straight Arm)
description: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and arms straight above your head.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and arms straight above your head.
