Step:2 Engaging your abs, lift your upper body off the ground while simultaneously lifting your legs towards your chest.
Step:3 Reach your hands towards your toes as you lift your upper body and legs.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body and legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Flexiones a Una Mano
description: Flexión completa realizada con un solo brazo de apoyo. Requiere fuerza y estabilización del core avanzadas.
howTo: Coloca una mano en el suelo a la línea media del cuerpo y la other detrás de la espalda. Separa los pies más del ancho de shoulders para estabilidad. Keep el cuerpo lo más recto posible, minimizando la rotación. Baja el pecho al suelo y empuja hacia arriba. Ejercicio que requiere fuerza extrema y control del core.

name: Flexiones Anchas
description: Flexiones con las manos más separadas que el ancho de los shoulders, enfocándose más en el pecho.
howTo: Coloca las manos más separadas que la anchura de los shoulders (aproximadamente 1.5 veces más). Keep el cuerpo recto y el core activado. Baja el pecho al suelo permitiendo que los codos se abran hacia los lados. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos. Esta variación enfatiza el trabajo del pecho exterior.

name: Flexiones Arquero
description: Flexión unilateral donde un brazo se estira hacia el lado mientras el otro flexiona. Paso previo a la flexión a una mano.
howTo: Coloca las manos muy separadas en el suelo. Baja el cuerpo hacia un lado, manteniendo ese brazo flexionado mientras el otro se extiende completamente. El brazo extended debe quedar recto con la palma en el suelo. Empuja de vuelta al centro y alterna los lados. Progresión directa hacia flexiones a una mano.

name: Flexiones Arquero Inclinadas
description: Progresión de arquero con manos elevadas para reducir la dificultad y practicar el movimiento unilateral.
howTo: Coloca las manos en una superficie elevada con una separación muy amplia. Baja el cuerpo hacia un lado, extendiendo completamente el brazo opuesto mientras el otro se flexiona. Alterna los lados en cada repetición. Esta variación desarrolla la fuerza unilateral necesaria para flexiones a una mano.

name: Flexiones Completas
description: Flexión estándar con cuerpo recto desde los talones hasta la cabeza.
howTo: Coloca las manos en el suelo a la anchura de los shoulders. Keep el cuerpo completamente recto desde los talones hasta la cabeza, con el core activado. Baja el pecho hasta que casi toque el suelo, manteniendo los codos a 45 grados. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender completamente los brazos. Keep la mirada ligeramente adelante.

name: Flexiones de Pino (Asistido en Pared)
description: Handstand Push-Up (HSPU) completo asistido con una pared para equilibrio.
howTo: Patéate hasta posición de pino contra la pared con brazos extendeds. Keep el cuerpo recto y el core activado. Baja con control hasta que la cabeza toque el suelo. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender completamente los brazos. Keep los talones tocando la pared para estabilidad. Ejercicio que requiere gran fuerza de shoulders.

name: Flexiones de Pino (Libre)
description: Flexión de pino realizada mientras se mantiene un pino libre, sin asistencia. Requiere equilibrio y fuerza de élite.
howTo: Patéate hasta posición de pino libre (sin pared) manteniendo el equilibrio. Keep el cuerpo completamente recto. Baja con control hasta que la cabeza toque el suelo. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos, manteniendo el equilibrio en todo momento. Requiere fuerza extrema de shoulders y excelente control del equilibrio.

name: Flexiones de Rodillas
description: Flexiones estándar pero apoyando las knees para reducir la palanca y la dificultad.
howTo: Colócate en posición de plancha, pero apoya las knees en el suelo. Keep una línea recta desde las knees hasta la cabeza. Baja el pecho al suelo manteniendo los codos a 45 grados del cuerpo. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos. Este ejercicio reduce aproximadamente 50% del peso corporal.

name: Flexiones Declinadas
description: Flexiones con los pies elevados en un banco. Aumenta la carga y enfoca la parte superior del pecho y shoulders.
howTo: Coloca los pies sobre una superficie elevada (banco) y las manos en el suelo a la anchura de los shoulders. Keep el cuerpo completamente recto. Baja el pecho al suelo manteniendo los codos a 45 grados. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos. Esta variación incrementa la carga y enfatiza los shoulders y el pecho superior.

name: Flexiones Diamante
description: Flexiones con manos juntas formando un diamante. Mayor énfasis en los tríceps.
howTo: Coloca las manos juntas bajo el pecho formando un diamante con los dedos índice y pulgar. Keep el cuerpo recto con el core activado. Baja el pecho hacia las manos manteniendo los codos pegados al cuerpo. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos. Esta variación pone gran énfasis en los tríceps.

name: Flexiones en Pared
description: Flexión vertical contra una pared. Ideal para principiantes absolutos para acostumbrar las articulaciones.
howTo: Párate frente a una pared a un brazo de distancia. Coloca las manos en la pared a la altura del pecho, a la anchura de shoulders. Inclínate hacia la pared flexionando los codos. Empuja de vuelta a la posición inicial. Cuanto más lejos de la pared, más difícil. Excelente para principiantes absolutos.

name: Pike Push-Ups
description: Flexión en V invertida (hips altas). Enfoca el trabajo en los shoulders, preparando para el HSPU.
howTo: Coloca las manos en el suelo a la anchura de los shoulders. Eleva las hips formando una V invertida con el cuerpo. Las legs deben estar lo más rectas posible. Baja la cabeza hacia el suelo flexionando los codos. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos. Este ejercicio enfatiza el trabajo de shoulders.

name: Flexiones en Pica (Pies Elevados)
description: Flexión en pica con pies elevados en un banco. Aumenta la carga sobre los shoulders, acercándose al HSPU.
howTo: Coloca los pies sobre una superficie elevada (banco) y las manos en el suelo. Forma una V invertida con el cuerpo, manteniendo las hips elevadas. Baja la cabeza hacia el suelo flexionando los codos. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos. La elevación aumenta la carga sobre los shoulders.

name: Flexiones Inclinadas
description: Flexiones con manos elevadas en un banco o caja. Reduce la carga del peso corporal.
howTo: Coloca las manos en una superficie elevada (banco o caja) a la altura del pecho. Keep el cuerpo recto desde la cabeza hasta los talones. Baja el pecho hacia la superficie manteniendo los codos cerca del cuerpo. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender completamente los brazos. Este ejercicio reduce la carga sobre el pecho, ideal para principiantes.

name: Typewriter Push-Ups
description: Similar to the archer push-up, but held low while sliding side to side.
howTo: Place the hands very wide on the floor. Lower to one side like an archer push-up. From the low position, slide horizontally to the other side, keeping the chest close to the floor, then press up on the other side. Requires high control and strength through the full range.

name: Plyometric Push-Ups
description: Explosive push-ups where the hands leave the floor (e.g., clap).
howTo: Comienza en posición de flexión estándar. Baja con control y luego empuja explosivamente para que las manos despeguen del suelo. Aterriza suavemente con los brazos ligeramente flexionados y baja inmediatamente a la siguiente repetición. Este ejercicio desarrolla potencia explosiva.

name: Flexiones Pseudo Planche
description: Advanced static hold that builds straight‑arm pressing strength and full‑body anti‑extension control. Requires strong anterior deltoids, triceps, and deep core while the shoulder blades stay protracted and slightly depressed. Increases shoulder torque versus tuck variations and develops control for harder planche progressions.
howTo:
1) Setup: Hands shoulder‑width; elbows locked. Protract and lightly depress the shoulder blades. Hollow body.
2) Enter/Hold: Lean forward until shoulders pass the wrists. Keep knees tucked/advanced‑tuck and back flat; push the floor away.
2) Breathing: Short exhales while maintaining bracing; avoid breath‑holding collapse.
2) Cues: 'Push tall', 'ribs down', 'squeeze glutes', 'externally rotate the shoulders'.
2) Errors: Elbow bend, scapular collapse, hips sag or piking.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Flutter Kicks
description: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your hands by your sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your hands by your sides.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground about 6 inches.
Step:3 Keeping your legs straight, alternate lifting one leg slightly higher than the other.
Step:4 Continue this fluttering motion for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Ring Dips
description: Fondos realizados en anillas gimnásticas. La inestabilidad aumenta drásticamente la dificultad y el reclutamiento del core.
howTo: Sube a posición de soporte en anillas con brazos completamente extendeds. Gira ligeramente las anillas hacia afuera (RTO ligero). Baja con control manteniendo las anillas cerca del cuerpo y estables. Los codos deben llegar a 90 grados o más. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender completamente los brazos. Requiere gran estabilidad del core.

name: Fondos en Anillas (Asistidos)
description: Fondos en anillas usando bandas elásticas para gestionar la inestabilidad y construir fuerza.
howTo: Coloca una banda en las anillas. Sube a posición de soporte con brazos extendeds y coloca las knees o pies en la banda. La inestabilidad de las anillas requiere más control del core. Baja con control manteniendo las anillas cerca del cuerpo. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos, rotando ligeramente las anillas hacia afuera en la parte superior.

name: Fondos en Anillas (Negativas)
description: Fase excéntrica controlada en anillas para construir la fuerza y estabilidad del hombro.
howTo: Salta o usa apoyo para llegar a posición de soporte en anillas con brazos extendeds. Keep las anillas giradas ligeramente hacia afuera. Baja lo más lento posible (5-8 segundos) manteniendo control total de las anillas. La inestabilidad de las anillas hace este ejercicio muy demandante. Usa las legs para volver arriba.

name: Fondos en Banco (Piernas Rectas)
description: Fondos en banco con legs estiradas y talones en el suelo. Aumenta la carga sobre los tríceps.
howTo: Siéntate en el borde de un banco, coloca las manos a los lados de las hips. Desliza las hips fuera del banco con las legs completamente extendeds y solo los talones en el suelo. Baja el cuerpo flexionando los codos hasta 90 grados. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos. Mayor dificultad que con knees flexionadas.

name: Fondos en Banco (Rodillas Flexionadas)
description: Fondos en banco con knees flexionadas y pies en el suelo. Ejercicio básico para tríceps.
howTo: Siéntate en el borde de un banco, coloca las manos a los lados de las hips. Desliza las hips fuera del banco con las knees flexionadas a 90 grados y los pies en el suelo. Baja el cuerpo flexionando los codos hasta 90 grados. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos. Keep los shoulders hacia abajo.

name: Parallel Bar Dips
description: Ejercicio fundamental de empuje para pecho, shoulders y tríceps realizado en barras paralelas.
howTo: Sube a las barras paralelas con brazos extendeds, cuerpo vertical. Inclínate ligeramente hacia adelante. Baja con control flexionando los codos hasta que estén a 90 grados o los shoulders estén a la altura de los codos. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender completamente los brazos. Keep el core activado.

name: Fondos en Paralelas (Negativas)
description: Salta a la posición superior y baja de forma lenta y controlada (3-5 segundos). Desarrolla la fuerza excéntrica.
howTo: Salta o usa un apoyo para llegar a la posición superior con brazos extendeds en las barras paralelas. Desde ahí, baja lo más lento posible (3-5 segundos mínimo) con control hasta que los codos estén a 90 grados o más. Usa las legs para volver arriba y repetir. Las negativas desarrollan fuerza excéntrica.

name: Fondos en Paralelas Asistidos
description: Fondos en paralelas usando bandas de resistencia o apoyo de pies para reducir el peso corporal.
howTo: Coloca una banda de resistencia en las barras paralelas. Sube a la posición superior con brazos extendeds y coloca las knees o pies en la banda. La banda te asistirá reduciendo el peso corporal. Baja con control hasta que los codos estén a 90 grados. Empuja hacia arriba hasta extender los brazos.

name: Fondos RTO a 90 grados
description: Un fondo avanzado donde el cuerpo se inclina horizontalmente (a 90 grados) en la parte inferior, con los anillos girados hacia afuera (RTO).
howTo: Sube a posición de soporte en anillas con brazos extendeds. Gira las anillas completamente hacia afuera (RTO completo, 90 grados de rotación). Keep esta rotación mientras bajas y subes en el fondo. Este ejercicio requiere fuerza extrema de shoulders y bíceps. Es una de las variaciones más difíciles de fondos.

name: Fondos Rusos
description: Fondos en paralelas que incluyen una transición sobre el antebrazo, trabajando el codo y el hombro en rangos profundos.
howTo: Comienza en posición de fondo en paralelas. En lugar de bajar verticalmente, lleva el cuerpo hacia adelante y hacia abajo, pasando por encima de las barras. Los shoulders deben ir muy por delante de las manos. Vuelve empujando hacia atrás y arriba. Este ejercicio prepara para la plancha y requiere fuerza extrema de shoulders.

name: Forward Jump
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position.
Step:3 Swing your arms back for momentum.
Step:4 Jump forward explosively, extending your hips, knees, and ankles.
Step:5 Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately go into the next jump.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Forward Lunge (male)
description: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
Step:2 Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge position.
Step:3 Bend your right knee to about 90 degrees, keeping your knee aligned with your ankle.
Step:4 Push off with your right foot and return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat with your left leg, alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Forward Lunge (male) With Bench
description: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
Step:2 Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge position.
Step:3 Bend your right knee to about 90 degrees, keeping your knee aligned with your ankle.
Step:4 Push off with your right foot and return to the starting position. Focus on bench movement.
Step:5 Repeat with your left leg, alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Frog Crunch
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Frog Planche
description: Advanced static hold that builds straight‑arm pressing strength and full‑body anti‑extension control. Requires strong anterior deltoids, triceps, and deep core while the shoulder blades stay protracted and slightly depressed. Increases shoulder torque versus tuck variations and develops control for harder planche progressions.
howTo:
1) Setup: Hands shoulder‑width; elbows locked. Protract and lightly depress the shoulder blades. Hollow body.
2) Enter/Hold: Lean forward until shoulders pass the wrists. Keep knees tucked/advanced‑tuck and back flat; push the floor away.
2) Breathing: Short exhales while maintaining bracing; avoid breath‑holding collapse.
2) Cues: 'Push tall', 'ribs down', 'squeeze glutes', 'externally rotate the shoulders'.
2) Errors: Elbow bend, scapular collapse, hips sag or piking.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Front Lever
description: Advanced isometric that trains the lats and posterior chain to keep the body horizontal with straight arms. Scapulae stay retracted and depressed, elbows locked, and the core braced to resist hip drop. Key step toward the full lever and one‑leg variations.
howTo:
1) Setup: Dead‑hang with pronated grip. Lock elbows; retract and depress the shoulder blades before lifting.
2) Enter/Hold: Bring knees away from chest (advanced tuck). Keep back flat and hips level with shoulders.
2) Tension: Drive elbows toward hips to engage lats; brace abs to resist hip drop.
2) Cues: 'Straight arms', 'crush the bar', 'lock the ribs to the pelvis'.
2) Errors: Bent elbows, rounded upper back, losing scapular set.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Front Lever (Una Pierna)
description: Advanced isometric that trains the lats and posterior chain to keep the body horizontal with straight arms. Scapulae stay retracted and depressed, elbows locked, and the core braced to resist hip drop. Key step toward the full lever and one‑leg variations.
howTo:

2) Enter/Hold: Bring knees away from chest (advanced tuck). Keep back flat and hips level with shoulders.
2) Tension: Drive elbows toward hips to engage lats; brace abs to resist hip drop.
2) Cues: 'Straight arms', 'crush the bar', 'lock the ribs to the pelvis'.
2) Errors: Bent elbows, rounded upper back, losing scapular set.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Front Lever Reps
description: Advanced isometric that trains the lats and posterior chain to keep the body horizontal with straight arms. Scapulae stay retracted and depressed, elbows locked, and the core braced to resist hip drop. Key step toward the full lever and one‑leg variations.

2) Errors: Bent elbows, rounded upper back, losing scapular set.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Front Plank With Twist
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to toe.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to toe.
Step:2 Engage your core and glutes to maintain a stable position.
Step:3 Rotate your torso to the right, lifting your right arm and extending it towards the ceiling.
Step:4 Keep your hips and legs stable as you twist.
Step:5 Hold for a moment, then return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat the twist on the left side.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Full Back Lever
description: Advanced isometric that trains the lats and posterior chain to keep the body horizontal with straight arms. Scapulae stay retracted and depressed, elbows locked, and the core braced to resist hip drop. Key step toward the full lever and one‑leg variations.
howTo:

2) Enter/Hold: Bring knees away from chest (advanced tuck). Keep back flat and hips level with shoulders.
2) Tension: Drive elbows toward hips to engage lats; brace abs to resist hip drop.
2) Cues: 'Straight arms', 'crush the bar', 'lock the ribs to the pelvis'.
2) Errors: Bent elbows, rounded upper back, losing scapular set.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Full Front Lever
description: Advanced isometric that trains the lats and posterior chain to keep the body horizontal with straight arms. Scapulae stay retracted and depressed, elbows locked, and the core braced to resist hip drop. Key step toward the full lever and one‑leg variations.
howTo:

2) Enter/Hold: Bring knees away from chest (advanced tuck). Keep back flat and hips level with shoulders.
2) Tension: Drive elbows toward hips to engage lats; brace abs to resist hip drop.
2) Cues: 'Straight arms', 'crush the bar', 'lock the ribs to the pelvis'.
2) Errors: Bent elbows, rounded upper back, losing scapular set.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Full Maltese
description: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight out to the sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight out to the sides.
Step:2 Slowly lean forward, keeping your arms straight, until your upper body is parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Engage your core and hold this position for a few seconds.
Step:4 Return to the starting position by pushing through your feet and standing back up.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Full Planche
description: Advanced static hold that builds straight‑arm pressing strength and full‑body anti‑extension control. Requires strong anterior deltoids, triceps, and deep core while the shoulder blades stay protracted and slightly depressed. Increases shoulder torque versus tuck variations and develops control for harder planche progressions.

name: Full Planche Push-up
description: Advanced static hold that builds straight‑arm pressing strength and full‑body anti‑extension control. Requires strong anterior deltoids, triceps, and deep core while the shoulder blades stay protracted and slightly depressed. Increases shoulder torque versus tuck variations and develops control for harder planche progressions.
howTo:

2) Enter/Hold: Lean forward until shoulders pass the wrists. Keep knees tucked/advanced‑tuck and back flat; push the floor away.
2) Breathing: Short exhales while maintaining bracing; avoid breath‑holding collapse.
2) Cues: 'Push tall', 'ribs down', 'squeeze glutes', 'externally rotate the shoulders'.
2) Errors: Elbow bend, scapular collapse, hips sag or piking.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Gironda Sternum Chin
description: Stand facing a high bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand facing a high bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Reach up and grab the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step:4 Engage your lats and biceps to pull your chest up towards the bar, leading with your sternum.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Glute Bridge March
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Engage your glutes and lift your hips off the ground, forming a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.
Step:3 While keeping your hips lifted, lift one foot off the ground and bring your knee towards your chest.
Step:4 Lower your foot back to the ground and repeat the movement with the other leg.
Step:5 Continue alternating legs in a marching motion while maintaining the bridge position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Glute Bridge Two Legs On Bench (male)
description: Sit on the edge of a bench with your back against it and your feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench with your back against it and your feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands on the bench beside your hips for support.
Step:3 Engage your glutes and hamstrings, then lift your hips off the bench until your body forms a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Glute-ham Raise
description: Adjust the glute-ham raise machine to fit your body.
howTo:
Step:1 Adjust the glute-ham raise machine to fit your body.
Step:2 Position yourself face down on the machine with your ankles secured.
Step:3 Place your hands on your chest or cross them over your chest.
Step:4 Engage your hamstrings and glutes to lift your upper body up towards the ceiling.
Step:5 Continue lifting until your body is in a straight line from your head to your heels.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Gorilla Chin
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Grasp a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:4 Engage your core and pull your body up towards the bar, bringing your chin above the bar.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Groin Crunch
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your legs off the ground, bringing your knees towards your chest.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Half Knee Bends (male)
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lower your body down as if you were sitting back into a chair.
Step:3 Keep your chest up and your weight in your heels.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Half Knee Bends (male) With Blunt
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lower your body down as if you were sitting back into a chair. Emphasize blunt control.
Step:3 Keep your chest up and your weight in your heels.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Half Sit-up (male)
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hamstring Stretch
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Step forward with your right foot and shift your weight onto your right leg.
Step:3 Keeping your back straight, slowly bend forward at the hips, reaching towards your right foot with both hands.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat on the other side.

name: Hands Clasped Circular Toe Touch (male)
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands clasped together in front of your chest.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands clasped together in front of your chest.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step:3 Lower your hands towards your toes in a circular motion, reaching as far as you can without straining.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hands Reversed Clasped Circular Toe Touch (male)
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended to the sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended to the sides.
Step:2 Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent.
Step:3 Reach down with your hands and clasp them together behind your legs.
Step:4 Slowly raise your hands up and over your head in a circular motion, keeping your legs straight.
Step:5 Continue the circular motion until your hands touch your toes.
Step:6 Reverse the motion and bring your hands back down to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Handstand
description: Find an open space with enough room to perform a handstand.
howTo:
Step:1 Find an open space with enough room to perform a handstand.
Step:2 Place your hands on the ground shoulder-width apart, fingers pointing forward.
Step:3 Kick your legs up towards the wall, using your core and shoulders to maintain balance.
Step:4 Once in a handstand position, engage your triceps to support your body weight.
Step:5 Hold the handstand for as long as you can maintain balance.
Step:6 To come down, slowly lower your legs back to the ground.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Handstand Push-up
description: Upside‑down straight‑arm hold emphasizing shoulder stacking, wrist tolerance, and core rigidity. Promotes balanced line, active shoulders, and fine control through the hands. Builds control for advanced freestanding and press handstand work.
howTo:
1) Setup: Hands slightly wider than shoulders; screw palms into the floor; elbows fully extended.
2) Descent/Ascent: Keep ribs down and glutes tight; press through full range without elbow flare.
2) Cues: 'Spread the floor', 'stack shoulders over wrists', 'move as one piece'.
2) Errors: Hip sag, shrugging shoulders, partial reps.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Hanging Leg Hip Raise
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up by flexing your hips and knees until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up in front of you, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Continue lifting until your legs are parallel to the ground or as high as you can comfortably go.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Oblique Knee Raise
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest, twisting your torso to the side as you do so.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat on the other side, twisting your torso in the opposite direction.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Pike
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up towards the bar, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Continue lifting until your body forms a 'V' shape, with your legs parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Hold the position for a moment, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Pike Weak
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up towards the bar, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Continue lifting until your body forms a 'V' shape, with your legs parallel to the ground. Emphasize weak control.
Step:4 Hold the position for a moment, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Pike With Intense
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up towards the bar, keeping them straight.
Step:3 (intense variation) Continue lifting until your body forms a 'V' shape, with your legs parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Hold the position for a moment, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Straight Leg Hip Raise
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up in front of you until they are parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Straight Leg Raise
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up in front of you, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Continue lifting until your legs are parallel to the ground or as high as you can comfortably go.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Straight Leg Raise With Elevated
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up in front of you, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Continue lifting until your legs are parallel to the ground or as high as you can comfortably go. Maintain elevated form throughout.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Straight Twisting Leg Hip Raise
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up towards your chest, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Once your legs are parallel to the ground, twist your hips to one side, bringing your legs towards that side.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the movement, but this time twist your hips to the opposite side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Straight Twisting Leg Hip Raise With Compound
description: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight.
howTo:
Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up towards your chest, keeping them straight. Perform with compound intensity.
Step:3 Once your legs are parallel to the ground, twist your hips to one side, bringing your legs towards that side.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the movement, but this time twist your hips to the opposite side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: High Knee Against Wall
description: Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
Step:2 Place your hands on the wall for support.
Step:3 Engage your core and lift your right knee up towards your chest, while keeping your left foot on the ground.
Step:4 Quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee up towards your chest and lowering your right foot back down.
Step:5 Continue alternating legs in a running motion, bringing your knees up as high as possible.
Step:6 Maintain a fast pace and keep your upper body stable throughout the exercise.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired duration or number of repetitions.

name: High Style Scapula Push-up
description: Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
Step:2 Lower your chest towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:3 As you lower, squeeze your shoulder blades together and push your chest forward. Focus on high movement.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hip Raise (bent Knee)
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands by your sides, palms facing down.
Step:3 Engage your core and glutes, then lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hollow Body Hold
description: Hollow Body Hold: a bodyweight exercise in the core category.
howTo: Acuéstate boca arriba. Presiona la espalda baja firmemente contra el suelo. Levanta las legs extendeds unos centímetros del suelo y levanta los shoulders y brazos extendeds. Tu cuerpo debe formar una ligera curva cóncava. Keep la espalda baja pegada al suelo. Este ejercicio es fundamental para gimnasia y calistenia.

name: Hollow Body Rocks
description: Hollow Body Rocks: a bodyweight exercise in the core category.
howTo: Comienza en posición de hollow body hold. Manteniendo la forma cóncava y la espalda baja contra el suelo, balancea suavemente hacia adelante y atrás. El movimiento debe venir del core, no de impulso de las extremidades. Este ejercicio desarrolla control del core dinámico.

name: HSPU en Pared (Negativas)
description: Bajar controladamente desde un pino en pared hasta que la cabeza toque el suelo. Construye la fuerza excéntrica.
howTo: Patéate hasta posición de pino contra la pared con brazos extendeds. Keep el cuerpo completamente recto. Baja lo más lento posible (3-5 segundos) hasta que la cabeza toque el suelo suavemente. Sal de la posición con cuidado y repite. Las negativas desarrollan fuerza para HSPU completas.

name: Hug Keens To Chest
description: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lower your body down into a squat position.
Step:3 As you squat down, bring your knees up towards your chest and hug them with your arms.
Step:4 Hold this position for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hyperextension
description: Adjust the hyperextension bench so that your upper thighs are resting on the pad and your feet are secured.
howTo:
Step:1 Adjust the hyperextension bench so that your upper thighs are resting on the pad and your feet are secured.
Step:2 Cross your arms over your chest or place your hands behind your head.
Step:3 Lower your upper body towards the ground while keeping your back straight.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then raise your upper body back up until it is in line with your legs.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hyperextension (on Bench)
description: Adjust the hyperextension bench so that your hips are resting comfortably on the pad and your feet are secured.
howTo:
Step:1 Adjust the hyperextension bench so that your hips are resting comfortably on the pad and your feet are secured.
Step:2 Cross your arms over your chest or place your hands behind your head.
Step:3 Slowly lower your upper body towards the ground while keeping your back straight.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then raise your upper body back up until it is in line with your legs.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Impossible Dips
description: Position yourself between two parallel bars with your arms fully extended and your body suspended in the air.
howTo:
Step:1 Position yourself between two parallel bars with your arms fully extended and your body suspended in the air.
Step:2 Bend your knees and cross your ankles.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Improved Sphinx
description: Lie face down on the ground with your forearms flat on the floor, elbows directly under your shoulders.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie face down on the ground with your forearms flat on the floor, elbows directly under your shoulders.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your chest off the ground, keeping your forearms and toes on the floor.
Step:3 Hold this position for a few seconds, making sure to keep your neck in a neutral position.
Step:4 Slowly lower your chest back down to the starting position. Emphasize improved control.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inchworm
description: Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart.
Step:2 Bend forward at the waist and place your hands on the ground in front of you.
Step:3 Walk your hands forward until you are in a high plank position, with your body in a straight line from head to toe.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then walk your hands back towards your feet, keeping your legs as straight as possible.
Step:5 Once your hands reach your feet, stand back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inchworm V. 2
description: Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart.
Step:2 Bend forward at the waist and place your hands on the ground in front of you.
Step:3 Walk your hands forward until you are in a high plank position, with your body in a straight line from head to toe.
Step:4 Keeping your legs straight, walk your feet towards your hands, bringing your hips up towards the ceiling.
Step:5 Continue walking your hands forward, repeating the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Close-grip Push-up
description: Place your hands on an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Place your hands on an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your legs behind you, resting on the balls of your feet, with your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the elevated surface by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Leg Hip Raise (leg Straight)
description: Lie on an incline bench with your back flat against the bench and your legs extended straight out in front of you.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie on an incline bench with your back flat against the bench and your legs extended straight out in front of you.
Step:2 Place your hands on the sides of the bench for support.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your legs off the bench, raising them as high as you can while keeping them straight.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Push Up Depth Jump
description: Find an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, and place your hands shoulder-width apart on the edge.
howTo:
Step:1 Find an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, and place your hands shoulder-width apart on the edge.
Step:2 Step your feet back, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the edge of the surface, bending your elbows and keeping your body aligned.
Step:4 Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:5 Jump off the edge of the surface, landing softly with your knees slightly bent.
Step:6 Repeat the push-up and depth jump for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Push Up Depth Jump With Complex
description: Find an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, and place your hands shoulder-width apart on the edge.
howTo:
Step:1 Find an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, and place your hands shoulder-width apart on the edge.
Step:2 Step your feet back, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the edge of the surface, bending your elbows and keeping your body aligned. Maintain complex form throughout.
Step:4 Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:5 Jump off the edge of the surface, landing softly with your knees slightly bent.
Step:6 Repeat the push-up and depth jump for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Push-up
description: Place your hands on an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Place your hands on an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your legs behind you, resting on the balls of your feet, creating a straight line from your head to your heels.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the elevated surface by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Push-up (on Box)
description: Place your hands on the edge of a box or elevated surface, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Place your hands on the edge of a box or elevated surface, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your legs behind you, resting on the balls of your feet, creating a straight line from your head to your heels.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the box by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Push-up (on Box) - Active Variation
description: Place your hands on the edge of a box or elevated surface, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Place your hands on the edge of a box or elevated surface, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your legs behind you, resting on the balls of your feet, creating a straight line from your head to your heels.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the box by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 (active variation) Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Reverse Grip Push-up
description: Place your hands on the edge of a bench or elevated surface, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Place your hands on the edge of a bench or elevated surface, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your legs behind you, resting on the balls of your feet, creating a straight line from your head to your heels.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the bench by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Scapula Push Up
description: Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
howTo:
Step:1 Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step:2 Place your hands on the bench slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Position your feet on the ground, hip-width apart.
Step:4 Lower your chest towards the bench, keeping your elbows tucked in.
Step:5 As you lower, retract your shoulder blades, squeezing your scapulae together.
Step:6 Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Twisting Sit-up
description: Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
howTo:
Step:1 Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step:2 Lie down on the bench with your feet secured under the foot pads.
Step:3 Place your hands behind your head or across your chest.
Step:4 Engage your abs and lift your upper body off the bench, curling forward.
Step:5 As you curl up, twist your torso to one side, bringing your elbow towards the opposite knee.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat the movement, this time twisting your torso to the other side.
Step:8 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inclined Style Pelvic Tilt Into Bridge
description: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your arms by your sides with your palms facing down.
Step:3 Engage your glutes and core muscles.
Step:4 Tilt your pelvis upward, lifting your hips off the ground. Emphasize inclined control.
Step:5 Hold the bridge position for a few seconds.
Step:6 Slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Intermediate Style Kneeling Plank Tap Shoulder (male)
description: Start in a kneeling position with your hands on the ground, shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a kneeling position with your hands on the ground, shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your legs behind you, resting on your toes, and lift your body into a plank position.
Step:3 (intermediate variation) Keeping your core engaged and your hips stable, lift one hand off the ground and tap the opposite shoulder.
Step:4 Return the hand to the ground and repeat with the other hand.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inverse Leg Curl (bench Support)
description: Lie face down on a bench with your hips at the edge and your legs extended straight behind you.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie face down on a bench with your hips at the edge and your legs extended straight behind you.
Step:2 Hold onto the bench for support.
Step:3 Keeping your upper body still, bend your knees and curl your legs towards your glutes.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly extend your legs back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inverse Leg Curl (on Pull-up Cable Machine)
description: Adjust the cable machine so that the ankle straps are at the lowest setting.
howTo:
Step:1 Adjust the cable machine so that the ankle straps are at the lowest setting.
Step:2 Lie face down on the bench with your legs extended and the ankle straps attached to your feet.
Step:3 Hold onto the handles of the bench for stability.
Step:4 Bend your knees and curl your legs towards your glutes, squeezing your hamstrings.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inverted Row
description: Set up a bar at waist height or use a suspension trainer.
howTo:
Step:1 Set up a bar at waist height or use a suspension trainer.
Step:2 Stand facing the bar or suspension trainer, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Grab the bar or handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Lean back, keeping your body straight and your heels on the ground.
Step:5 Pull your chest towards the bar or handles, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inverted Row Bent Knees
description: Set up a bar at waist height and lie underneath it.
howTo:
Step:1 Set up a bar at waist height and lie underneath it.
Step:2 Grab the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Position your body so that your heels are on the ground and your body is straight.
Step:4 Pull your chest up towards the bar by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inverted Row On Bench
description: Set up a bench at a height that allows your body to hang freely underneath it.
howTo:
Step:1 Set up a bench at a height that allows your body to hang freely underneath it.
Step:2 Lie face up on the ground with your head towards the bench.
Step:3 Reach up and grab the bench with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Position your body so that your heels are on the ground and your arms are fully extended.
Step:5 Engage your core and squeeze your shoulder blades together as you pull your chest up towards the bench.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inverted Row V. 2
description: Set up a bar at waist height on a Smith machine or use a suspension trainer.
howTo:
Step:1 Set up a bar at waist height on a Smith machine or use a suspension trainer.
Step:2 Stand facing the bar or suspension trainer and grab it with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Walk your feet forward, leaning back until your body is at a slight angle.
Step:4 Keep your body straight and pull your chest up towards the bar or handles, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inverted Row With Straps
description: Set up a suspension trainer or straps at chest height.
howTo:
Step:1 Set up a suspension trainer or straps at chest height.
Step:2 Stand facing the anchor point and grab the handles with an overhand grip.
Step:3 Walk your feet forward, leaning back until your body is at an angle.
Step:4 Keep your body straight and engage your core.
Step:5 Pull your chest towards the handles, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inverted Style Inverse Leg Curl (on Pull-up Cable Machine)
description: Adjust the cable machine so that the ankle straps are at the lowest setting.
howTo:
Step:1 Adjust the cable machine so that the ankle straps are at the lowest setting.
Step:2 Lie face down on the bench with your legs extended and the ankle straps attached to your feet.
Step:3 Hold onto the handles of the bench for stability.
Step:4 Bend your knees and curl your legs towards your glutes, squeezing your hamstrings.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Maintain inverted form throughout.

name: Iron Cross Stretch
description: Lie flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides.
Step:2 Raise your legs up towards the ceiling, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Slowly lower your legs to one side, aiming to touch the floor with your feet.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for a few seconds, then return your legs to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the stretch on the other side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Iron Cross Stretch - Deep Variation
description: Lie flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides.
Step:2 Raise your legs up towards the ceiling, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Slowly lower your legs to one side, aiming to touch the floor with your feet.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for a few seconds, then return your legs to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the stretch on the other side. Maintain deep form throughout.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Isometric Chest Squeeze
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight out in front of you, parallel to the ground, with your palms facing each other.
Step:3 Squeeze your chest muscles together as hard as you can, while keeping your arms straight.
Step:4 Hold this position for a few seconds, focusing on contracting your chest muscles.
Step:5 Release the squeeze and relax your chest muscles.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Isometric Wipers
description: Start by lying flat on your back on a mat or bench.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by lying flat on your back on a mat or bench.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight out to the sides, perpendicular to your body.
Step:3 Engage your core and lift both legs off the ground, keeping them together and straight.
Step:4 Slowly lower your legs to one side, aiming to touch the ground with your feet while maintaining control.
Step:5 Pause for a moment, then use your core to lift your legs back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat the movement, this time lowering your legs to the opposite side.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Jack Burpee
description: Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you.
Step:3 Kick your feet back, landing in a push-up position.
Step:4 Perform a push-up, lowering your chest to the ground and then pushing back up.
Step:5 Jump your feet forward, landing in a squat position.
Step:6 Jump up explosively, reaching your arms overhead.
Step:7 Land softly and immediately lower back into the squat position to begin the next repetition.

name: Jack Jump (male)
description: Stand with your feet together and your arms by your sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet together and your arms by your sides.
Step:2 Jump up, spreading your feet apart and raising your arms above your head.
Step:3 As you land, quickly jump back to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Jackknife Sit-up
description: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms overhead.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms overhead.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs and upper body simultaneously, reaching your hands towards your toes.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs and upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Janda Sit-up
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Jump Squat
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Step:3 Jump explosively off the ground, extending your hips, knees, and ankles.
Step:4 While in mid-air, quickly bring your arms forward for balance.
Step:5 Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately go into the next repetition.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Jump Squat V. 2
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Step:3 Jump explosively, extending your hips and knees fully.
Step:4 Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately lower your body back into a squat position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Jumping Jacks
description: Jumping Jacks: a bodyweight exercise in the cardio category.
howTo: Párate con los pies juntos y los brazos a los lados. Salta separando los pies más allá del ancho de shoulders mientras llevas los brazos arriba sobre la cabeza. Salta de nuevo para volver a la posición inicial. Keep un ritmo constante. Ejercicio cardiovascular clásico para calentamiento.

name: Kick Out Sit
description: Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step:2 Lean back slightly and place your hands on the edge of the bench or chair for support.
Step:3 Engaging your hamstrings, lift your feet off the ground and extend your legs straight out in front of you.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly bend your knees and bring your feet back towards your body.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Kipping Muscle Up
description: Advanced bodyweight pattern requiring high scapular control, full‑body tension and precise leverage. Keep elbows locked (if straight‑arm), brace the core, and maintain clean lines to handle the increased torque.
howTo:
1) Setup: Create full‑body tension before moving; set the shoulders and brace the core.
2) Execution: Move under control; keep lines clean and leverage consistent.
2) Cues: 'Stay tight', 'own the range', 'quality over quantity'.
2) Errors: Rushed tempo, compensations, breaking alignment.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Kipping Muscle Up With Triple
description: Advanced bodyweight pattern requiring high scapular control, full‑body tension and precise leverage. Keep elbows locked (if straight‑arm), brace the core, and maintain clean lines to handle the increased torque.
howTo:
1) Setup: Create full‑body tension before moving; set the shoulders and brace the core.
2) Execution: Move under control; keep lines clean and leverage consistent.
2) Cues: 'Stay tight', 'own the range', 'quality over quantity'.
2) Errors: Rushed tempo, compensations, breaking alignment.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Knee Touch Crunch
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your shoulder blades off the ground and reach your right hand towards your left knee.
Step:4 Return to the starting position and repeat, this time reaching your left hand towards your right knee.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Kneeling Lat Stretch
description: Kneel on the ground with your knees hip-width apart and your toes pointing back.
howTo:
Step:1 Kneel on the ground with your knees hip-width apart and your toes pointing back.
Step:2 Extend your arms overhead and interlace your fingers.
Step:3 Keeping your back straight, slowly lean to the right side, feeling a stretch in your left lat muscle.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the stretch on the left side, leaning to the left and feeling a stretch in your right lat muscle.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Kneeling Plank Tap Shoulder (male)
description: Start in a kneeling position with your hands on the ground, shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start in a kneeling position with your hands on the ground, shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your legs behind you, resting on your toes, and lift your body into a plank position.
Step:3 Keeping your core engaged and your hips stable, lift one hand off the ground and tap the opposite shoulder.
Step:4 Return the hand to the ground and repeat with the other hand.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Kneeling Push-up (male)
description: Start by kneeling on the ground with your hands shoulder-width apart, fingers pointing forward.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by kneeling on the ground with your hands shoulder-width apart, fingers pointing forward.
Step:2 Extend your legs behind you, resting on the balls of your feet, so that your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
Step:3 Engage your core and lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
Step:4 Continue lowering until your chest is just above the ground, then push back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Korean Dips
description: Position yourself between two parallel bars with your arms extended and supporting your body weight.
howTo:
Step:1 Position yourself between two parallel bars with your arms extended and supporting your body weight.
Step:2 Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Pause for a moment, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: L-pull-up
description: Grab the pull-up bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Grab the pull-up bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Hang with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step:3 Engage your lats and biceps to pull your body up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:4 Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: L-Sit
description: High‑tension core position that teaches rib‑to‑pelvis connection and scapular control. Maintaining a consistent hollow line prevents spinal extension and improves transfer to skills and levers.
howTo:
1) Setup: Posterior pelvic tilt (ribs down), arms locked as needed; reach long through shoulders.
2) Hold: Keep constant tension; no lumbar arch. Point toes and squeeze quads/glutes.
2) Cues: 'Navel to spine', 'long line', 'keep shoulders active'.
2) Errors: Back arch, bent elbows (when not intended), broken line.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: L-Sit (Una Pierna)
description: High‑tension core position that teaches rib‑to‑pelvis connection and scapular control. Maintaining a consistent hollow line prevents spinal extension and improves transfer to skills and levers.
howTo:
1) Setup: Posterior pelvic tilt (ribs down), arms locked as needed; reach long through shoulders.
2) Hold: Keep constant tension; no lumbar arch. Point toes and squeeze quads/glutes.
2) Cues: 'Navel to spine', 'long line', 'keep shoulders active'.
2) Errors: Back arch, bent elbows (when not intended), broken line.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: L-Sit en Paralelas
description: High‑tension core position that teaches rib‑to‑pelvis connection and scapular control. Maintaining a consistent hollow line prevents spinal extension and improves transfer to skills and levers.
howTo:
1) Setup: Posterior pelvic tilt (ribs down), arms locked as needed; reach long through shoulders.
2) Hold: Keep constant tension; no lumbar arch. Point toes and squeeze quads/glutes.
2) Cues: 'Navel to spine', 'long line', 'keep shoulders active'.
2) Errors: Back arch, bent elbows (when not intended), broken line.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: L-Sit en Suelo
description: High‑tension core position that teaches rib‑to‑pelvis connection and scapular control. Maintaining a consistent hollow line prevents spinal extension and improves transfer to skills and levers.
howTo:
1) Setup: Posterior pelvic tilt (ribs down), arms locked as needed; reach long through shoulders.
2) Hold: Keep constant tension; no lumbar arch. Point toes and squeeze quads/glutes.
2) Cues: 'Navel to spine', 'long line', 'keep shoulders active'.
2) Errors: Back arch, bent elbows (when not intended), broken line.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: L-sit On Floor
description: High‑tension core position that teaches rib‑to‑pelvis connection and scapular control. Maintaining a consistent hollow line prevents spinal extension and improves transfer to skills and levers.
howTo:
1) Setup: Posterior pelvic tilt (ribs down), arms locked as needed; reach long through shoulders.
2) Hold: Keep constant tension; no lumbar arch. Point toes and squeeze quads/glutes.
2) Cues: 'Navel to spine', 'long line', 'keep shoulders active'.
2) Errors: Back arch, bent elbows (when not intended), broken line.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Lean Planche
description: Advanced static hold that builds straight‑arm pressing strength and full‑body anti‑extension control. Requires strong anterior deltoids, triceps, and deep core while the shoulder blades stay protracted and slightly depressed. Increases shoulder torque versus tuck variations and develops control for harder planche progressions.
howTo:
1) Setup: Hands shoulder‑width; elbows locked. Protract and lightly depress the shoulder blades. Hollow body.
2) Enter/Hold: Lean forward until shoulders pass the wrists. Keep knees tucked/advanced‑tuck and back flat; push the floor away.
2) Breathing: Short exhales while maintaining bracing; avoid breath‑holding collapse.
2) Cues: 'Push tall', 'ribs down', 'squeeze glutes', 'externally rotate the shoulders'.
2) Errors: Elbow bend, scapular collapse, hips sag or piking.
coachingTip: Generate full‑body tension; if the core relaxes, leverage breaks and control is lost.

name: Left Hook. Boxing
description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
howTo:
Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Keep your left hand up to protect your face and your right hand by your chin.
Step:3 Rotate your hips and pivot on your left foot as you extend your left arm forward in a punching motion.
Step:4 Twist your torso and engage your core muscles to generate power in the punch.
Step:5 Snap your arm back to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Leg Pull In Flat Bench
description: Sit on a flat bench with your legs extended straight out in front of you.
howTo:
Step:1 Sit on a flat bench with your legs extended straight out in front of you.
Step:2 Place your hands on the bench beside your hips for support.
Step:3 Engage your abs and lift your legs off the ground, bringing your knees towards your chest.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Leg Up Hamstring Stretch
description: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your legs extended.
Step:2 Bend one knee and bring it towards your chest, holding onto your thigh or shin.
Step:3 Straighten your leg as much as possible while keeping it elevated.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds.
Step:5 Repeat with the other leg.

name: Low Glute Bridge On Floor
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your arms by your sides, palms facing down.
Step:3 Engage your glutes and core, then lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your glutes.
Step:5 Slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Lower Back Curl
description: Lie flat on your stomach with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your stomach with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
Step:2 Engage your glutes and hamstrings, and slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling your back upwards.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Lunge With Jump
description: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Take a step forward with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge position.
Step:3 Push off with your right foot and jump into the air, switching the position of your feet mid-air.
Step:4 Land softly with your left foot forward and immediately lower your body into a lunge position.
Step:5 Continue alternating between lunges and jumps for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Lunge With Twist
description: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
howTo:
Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Take a step forward with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge position.
Step:3 As you lunge, twist your torso to the right, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat on the other side, stepping forward with your left foot and twisting your torso to the left.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Lying (side) Quads Stretch
description: Lie on your side with your legs straight.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie on your side with your legs straight.
Step:2 Bend your top leg and grab your ankle or foot with your hand.
Step:3 Gently pull your ankle or foot towards your glutes until you feel a stretch in your quads.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds.
Step:5 Release the stretch and repeat on the other side.

name: Lying Elbow To Knee
description: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engage your abs and lift your upper body off the ground, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee.
Step:4 At the same time, extend your right leg straight out and lift it off the ground.
Step:5 Pause for a moment, then return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat the movement, this time bringing your left elbow towards your right knee and extending your left leg.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Lying Leg Raise Flat Bench
description: Lie flat on a flat bench with your back pressed against it.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on a flat bench with your back pressed against it.
Step:2 Place your hands under your glutes for support.
Step:3 Keep your legs straight and together, and lift them up towards the ceiling.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Lying Leg-hip Raise
description: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
Step:2 Place your hands under your glutes for support.
Step:3 Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground, raising them towards the ceiling.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Lying Leg-hip Raise - Contracted Variation
description: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
howTo:
Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
Step:2 Place your hands under your glutes for support.
Step:3 Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground, raising them towards the ceiling.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position. Emphasize contracted control.
